snippet: A ruling by an obscure administrative court has put an end to any chance that a new constitution would be drafted before the presidential election, raising the stakes in race.
abstract: Egyptian administrative court suspends a committee appointed to draft a new constitution, all but guaranteeing that Egypt will elect a president before it ratifies a new charter; without a new constitution, the winner of the presidential election will technically assume the same powers wielded by former Pres Hosni Mubarak before his ouster.
lead_paragraph: A ruling by an obscure administrative court has put an end to any chance that a new constitution would be drafted before the presidential election, raising the stakes in race.

headline.seo: Court Flips Egypt’s Timetable: Constitution Now Follows Vote
headline.main: Court Flips Egypt’s Timetable: Election, Then Constitution
headline.print_headline: Move by Court in Egypt Puts Vote Before Charter

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
